page.title: 08DUFTON WOOD FARM 2 _LAND.
page.content: We have a fell allotment (enclosed land) a good distance from the farm & grazing on Dufton Open Fell,where we run our sheep.We have 173 acres of 'in by' land (close to the house).We plough 10-12 acres,& follow the cycle; barley,turnips, barley, hay, hay, hay, pasture, back to barley.We also have some meadow that we never plough,where we lamb the sheep,sheltered from the noted Helm wind.Our fell allotment rises to 1800',the highest fenced land in Dufton parish.Our meadow land is the lowest in the parish.Two large streams meet at the bottom of it, & we sometimes get severe flooding after thunderstorms or snow melting in spring.The barley is combine-harvested & the grain crushed for the stock;most of the straw is used to help the hay ration last through the long winter. Cows are fed inside for 6 months here.
